trans-unit.source: Represents a parent/child relationship between two <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> objects.
A <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> is used to relate two <xref:System.Data.DataTable> objects to each other through <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> objects.
For example, in a Customer/Orders relationship, the Customers table is the parent and the Orders table is the child of the relationship.
This is similar to a primary key/foreign key relationship.
For more information, see [Navigating DataRelations](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataset-datatable-dataview/navigating-datarelations.md).
Relationships are created between matching columns in the parent and child tables.
That is, the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.DataType%2A> value for both columns must be identical.
Relationships can also cascade various changes from the parent <xref:System.Data.DataRow> to its child rows.
To control how values are changed in child rows, add a <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> to the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection> of the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> object.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection> determines what action to take when a value in a parent table is deleted or updated.
When a <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> is created, it first verifies that the relationship can be established.
After it is added to the <xref:System.Data.DataRelationCollection>, the relationship is maintained by disallowing any changes that would invalidate it.

Between the period when a <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> is created and added to the <xref:System.Data.DataRelationCollection>, it is possible for additional changes to be made to the parent or child rows.
An exception is generated if this causes a relationship that is no longer valid.
Data corruption can occur if a bi-directional relation is defined between two tables.
A bi-directional relation consists of two `DataRelation` objects that use the same columns, with the parent-child roles switched.
No exception is raised when the `DataRelation` objects are saved; however, data corruption can occur.

<xref:System.Data.DataRelation> objects are contained in a <xref:System.Data.DataRelationCollection>, which you can access through the <xref:System.Data.DataSet.Relations%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.DataSet>, and the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.ChildRelations%2A> and <xref:System.Data.DataTable.ParentRelations%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> name, and parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref>.
If `null` or an empty string (""), a default name will be given when the created object is added to the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelationCollection"></xref>.
The parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the relationship.
The child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the relationship.
One or both of the <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects contains `null`.
The columns have different data types
-Or-
The tables do not belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> name and matched arrays of parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
The name of the relation.
If `null` or an empty string (""), a default name will be given when the created object is added to the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelationCollection"></xref>.
An array of parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
An array of child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
One or both of the <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects contains `null`.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects have different data types
-Or-
One or both of the arrays are not composed of distinct columns from the same table.
-Or-
The tables do not belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> class using the specified name, parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects, and a value that indicates whether to create constraints.
The name of the relation.
If `null` or an empty string (""), a default name will be given when the created object is added to the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelationCollection"></xref>.
The parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the relation.
The child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the relation.
A value that indicates whether constraints are created.
`true`, if constraints are created.
Otherwise, `false`.
One or both of the <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects contains `null`.
The columns have different data types
-Or-
The tables do not belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> class using the specified name, matched arrays of parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects, and value that indicates whether to create constraints.
The name of the relation.
If `null` or an empty string (""), a default name will be given when the created object is added to the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelationCollection"></xref>.
An array of parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
An array of child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
A value that indicates whether to create constraints.
`true`, if constraints are created.
Otherwise, `false`.
One or both of the <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects is `null`.
The columns have different data types
-Or-
The tables do not belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
This constructor is provided for design time support in the Visual Studio environment.

Any <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> object created by using this constructor must be added to the collection with the <xref:System.Data.DataRelationCollection.AddRange%2A> method inside of a <xref:System.Data.DataTable.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Data.DataTable.EndInit%2A> block.
If this constructor is not called between <xref:System.Data.DataTable.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Data.DataTable.EndInit%2A> a <xref:System.NullReferenceException> will occur.
In addition, the tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time the constructor is called.
The name of the relation.
If `null` or an empty string (""), a default name will be given when the created object is added to the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelationCollection"></xref>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that is the parent table of the relation.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that is the child table of the relation.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> object names in the parent <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> of the relation.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> object names in the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> of the relation.
A value that indicates whether relationships are nested.
This constructor is provided for design time support in the Visual Studio environment.
Any <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> object created by using this constructor must then be added to the collection with <xref:System.Data.DataRelationCollection.AddRange%2A>.

Tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time the method is called, or if <xref:System.Data.DataTable.BeginInit%2A> has been called before calling this constructor, the tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time that <xref:System.Data.DataTable.EndInit%2A> is called.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref>.
If `null` or an empty string (""), a default name will be given when the created object is added to the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelationCollection"></xref>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that is the parent table of the relation.
The name of the parent table namespace.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that is the child table of the relation.
The name of the child table namespace.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> object names in the parent <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> of the relation.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> object names in the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> of the relation.
A value that indicates whether relationships are nested.
This method supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The parent and child tables belong to different <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> objects.
-Or-
One or more pairs of parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects have mismatched data types.
-Or-
The parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects are identical.
Gets the child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects of this relation.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> for the relation.

If no associated <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> exists for this relationship, it will be created automatically, and pointed to by the `ChildKeyConstraint`, when the relation is added to the collection of relations.
A `ForeignKeyConstraint`.
Gets the child table of this relation.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that is the child table of the relation.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> to which the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> belongs.

The <xref:System.Data.DataRelationCollection> associated with a <xref:System.Data.DataSet> is accessed through the <xref:System.Data.DataSet.Relations%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.DataSet> object.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> to which the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> belongs.
Gets the collection that stores customized properties.
Use <xref:System.Data.DataRelation.ExtendedProperties%2A> to add custom information to a <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> object.
Add information with the Add method.
Retrieve information with the Item method.
Extended properties must be of type <xref:System.String>.
Properties that are not of type String are not persisted when the <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> is written as XML.
A <xref href="System.Data.PropertyCollection"></xref> that contains customized properties.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> objects are nested.
You can use <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> objects to define hierarchical relationships, such as those specified in XML.
For more information, see [Nesting DataRelations](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataset-datatable-dataview/nesting-datarelations.md).

If the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.TableName%2A> of the child table in the relation matches the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName%2A> of a column in the parent table in the relation, the <xref:System.Data.DataRelation.Nested%2A> property must be false.
This was not required with the .NET Framework version 1.0.
`true`, if <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> objects are nested; otherwise, `false`.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Parameter reference.
Gets an array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects that are the parent columns of this <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref>.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects that are the parent columns of this <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> that guarantees that values in the parent column of a <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> are unique.
A <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> that makes sure that values in a parent column are unique.
Gets the parent <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that is the parent table of this relation.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Parameter reference.
Gets or sets the name used to retrieve a <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelationCollection"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Data.DataRelation.RelationName%2A> property to retrieve a <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> from the <xref:System.Data.DataRelationCollection>.
The name of the a <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref>.
`null` or empty string ("") was passed into a <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> that is a <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> belongs to a collection that already contains a <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> with the same name.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation.RelationName"></xref>, if one exists.
The value of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation.RelationName"></xref> property.
